subject: Fun Stats from sloccount
body:
The numbers would be higher if sloccount recognized Parrot code.

I might add that shortly.

-- c

Totals grouped by language (dominant language first):
ansic:       194913 (51.89%)
perl:        167865 (44.69%)
java:          3908 (1.04%)
tcl:           3228 (0.86%)
yacc:          2369 (0.63%)
lex:           1376 (0.37%)
lisp:          1150 (0.31%)
python:         298 (0.08%)
ruby:           271 (0.07%)
sh:              92 (0.02%)
asm:             76 (0.02%)
cpp:             36 (0.01%)
cs:              29 (0.01%)




Total Physical Source Lines of Code (SLOC)                = 375,611
Development Effort Estimate, Person-Years (Person-Months) = 101.04 (1,212.51)
 (Basic COCOMO model, Person-Months = 2.4 * (KSLOC**1.05))
Schedule Estimate, Years (Months)                         = 3.09 (37.13)
 (Basic COCOMO model, Months = 2.5 * (person-months**0.38))
Estimated Average Number of Developers (Effort/Schedule)  = 32.65
Total Estimated Cost to Develop                           = $ 13,649,503
 (average salary = $56,286/year, overhead = 2.40).
